Other Information.Additional Info: The UiO-66 nanoparticles are expected to exhibit a high selectivity of water over salts.
The sub-nanometer pores of UiO-66 nanoparticles block hydrated ions like Na+.
The sub-nanometer pores of UiO-66 nanoparticles block hydrated ions like Cl-.

Experimental Validation.Performance Metrics: For TFN-U2 membrane (0.1 wt% UiO-66 loading), the water permeability coefficient increased by approximately 50% compared to unmodified TFC membrane with comparable salt rejection (~95%). Maximum water flux achieved was 36.7 LMH in PRO mode and 20.7 LMH in FO mode using DI water as feed and 1 M NaCl as draw solution.

Other Information.Additional Info: Incorporation of UiO-66 nanoparticles significantly changed the membrane morphology and chemistry, leading to improved intrinsic separation properties due to molecular sieving and super-hydrophilic nature of UiO-66 particles.
